libraries.name: dart-core
libraries.preview: Built-in types, collections, and other core functionality for every Dart program.

libraries.name: dart-collection
libraries.preview: Classes and utilities that supplement the collection support in dart:core.

libraries.name: dart-math
libraries.preview: Mathematical constants and functions, plus a random number generator.

libraries.name: dart-convert
libraries.preview: Encoders and decoders for converting between different data representations, including JSON and UTF-8.

libraries.name: dart-async
libraries.preview: Support for asynchronous programming, with classes such as Future and Stream.

libraries.name: dart-isolate
libraries.preview: Concurrent programming using isolates: independent workers that are similar to threads but don't share memory, communicating only via messages.

libraries.name: dart-mirrors
libraries.preview: Basic reflection in Dart, with support for introspection and dynamic evaluation.

libraries.name: dart-io
libraries.preview: File, socket, HTTP, and other I/O support for server applications.

libraries.name: dart-typed_data
libraries.preview: Specialized integers and floating point numbers, with SIMD support and efficient lists.

libraries.name: dart-dom-html
libraries.preview: HTML elements and other resources for web-based applications that need to interact with the browser and the DOM (Document Object Model).

libraries.name: dart-dom-indexed_db
libraries.preview: A client-side key-value store with support for indexes.

libraries.name: dart-dom-svg
libraries.preview: Scalable Vector Graphics: Two-dimensional vector graphics with support for events and animation.

libraries.name: dart-dom-web_sql
libraries.preview: An API for storing data in the browser that can be queried with SQL.

introduction:
Welcome to the Dart API reference documentation, covering the official Dart API libraries. Some of the most fundamental Dart libraries include:

  • dart:core: Core functionality such as strings, numbers, collections, errors, dates, and URIs.

  • dart:html: DOM manipulation for web apps.

  • dart:io: I/O for command-line apps.

Except for dart:core, you must import a library before you can use it. Here's an example of importing dart:html, dart:math, and a third popular library called polymer.dart:

import 'dart:html';
import 'dart:math';
import 'package:polymer/polymer.dart';

Polymer.dart is an example of a library that isn't included in the Dart download, but is easy to get and update using the pub package manager. For information on finding, using, and publishing libraries (and more) with pub, see pub.dartlang.org.

The main site for learning and using Dart is www.dartlang.org. Check out these pages:

  • Dart homepage
  • Tutorials
  • Programmer's Guide
  • Samples
  • A Tour of the Dart Libraries

This API reference is automatically generated from the source code in the Dart project. If you'd like to contribute to this documentation, see Contributing and Writing API Documentation.
